page.title: omniORB development
page.head: omniORB development
page.p: omniORB development happens in CVS. See the omniORB CVS page for generic instructions, or browse the repository.

All omniORB development happens in branches, so you must always specify a branch tag when you do a checkout. The trunk of the tree always contains the most recent stable release, so you won't see much change there.
The omniORB core libraries and tools are in the omni CVS package. The branches are

omniORB for Python has its own CVS package, named omniORBpy. You must match the omniORBpy version you use with the core omniORB version you have. omniORBpy 1.x goes with omniORB 3.0.x; omniORBpy 2.x goes with omniORB 4.0.x.
The branches in the omniORBpy package are

With omniORBpy 1.x you must checkout the omniORBpy package within the src/lib directory of an omniORBpy 3.0.x tree. With omniORBpy 2.x, you must still do that if you use the old build system, but you can check it out anywhere you like if you use the autoconf based build.
